feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Supply Chain Management
feed.subtitle: SAP Supply Chain Management Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Issue with Purchase Price Variance Posting in SAP ByDesign
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are experiencing an issue in SAP Business ByDesign related to product valuation during the procurement process.

Here’s the scenario:

  • In the product master data, under Valuation, we maintain a cost price of 1 Naira.
  • When creating a Purchase Order, we may buy the product at a different price (for example, 1,000 Naira per unit).
  • After posting the Goods Receipt, we noticed that the system splits the posting as follows:
    • Debit Material: 1.00 NGN
    • Credit Goods not yet Invoiced: 1000.00 NGN
    • Debit Difference in purchasing: 999.00 NGN

Our expectation is that the entire 1,000 Naira should be debited to the Material (inventory) account, not split between product valuation and purchase price difference.

Question:
How can we configure or treat this so that the full purchase price is capitalized in inventory, instead of posting most of it to the “purchase price difference” account?

Any guidance on the correct setup or configuration would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: How to add the Freight Charges during GRN ?
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Could you please confirm the correct process for adding Freight charges during Goods Receipt in SAP Public Cloud?

The client’s requirement is that freight charges are not available at the time of Purchase Order creation. However, when they receive the lots, the freight details are known. Since they usually receive the quantities partially, they would like to include the applicable freight charges during GRN, based on the lot actually received.

Could you please advise how this process can be mapped in SAP Public Cloud?

entry.title: How the capacity planning works in warehouse management (public cloud)?
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Could you please explain how capacity planning functions in warehouse management within SAP Public Cloud?

The client’s requirement involves handling two types of storage bins:

  • Storage bin with a capacity of 1.0 TO

  • Storage bin with a capacity of 1.5 TO

There is a material called SS wire roll, which is procured from different suppliers and varies in weight. Using batch-specific units of measure during synchronous goods receipt, the process is as follows:

  • Material with a weight less than or equal to 1.0 TO should be placed in a 1.0 TO bin.

  • Material with a weight greater than 1.0 TO but less than or equal to 1.5 TO should be stored in a 1.5 TO bin

Additionally, if all 1.0 TO bins are full, materials weighing less than or equal to 1.0 TO may need to be placed in a 1.5 TO bin, with up to 4 quantities per bin depending on their size.

 

How the process can be mapped in sap public cloud warehouse management? please advise me on priority.

entry.title: How dunning process will work with purchasing value key (SAP Public Cloud)
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

The client requires that notifications be sent automatically to the vendor based on the purchasing value key timeline. I have configured the output parameter for this purpose; however, the system is not triggering the notification in SAP Public Cloud.

Could you please advise as a priority if any additional steps are required? Additionally, I would appreciate it if you could provide the detailed configuration steps.

entry.title: Issue with Batch-Specific UOM Quantity Display in Warehouse Monitor vs MMBE in SAP Public Cloud.
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

While receiving material with batch-specific UOM through synchronous goods receipt in Warehouse Management in SAP Public Cloud, I observed an issue.

The base UOM for the material is TO, and the alternative UOM is EA. I am receiving the material in EA with a batch-specific UOM ratio, where each EA is considered as a handling unit. However, when I check the received quantity in the Warehouse Monitor app, the EA is displayed according to the batch-specific UOM ratio instead of reflecting the actual received quantity in EA.

On the other hand, when I check in MMBE, the receiving quantity is displayed correctly.

Could you please advise on the reason for this discrepancy and the possible resolution?

entry.title: Requirement for Maintaining and Posting Landed Cost During Goods Receipt for Partial Purchase Order
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

The client requires a solution for scenarios where the landed cost (freight and customs charges) is not known at the time of creating the purchase order. When receiving lots and posting Goods Receipt (GRN), the actual landed cost becomes available, which may also apply to partial quantities of the purchase order. The client would like to maintain the landed cost during GRN, ensuring that it is posted to the received lot’s material.

Please advise on how this process can be mapped in the system on priority.

entry.content:

There is a report (standard) that shows the PR and PO pending approval and their respective approver? Or only Z?

Thanks.

entry.title: S4HANA private - split FU creation for delivery note based on dynamic criteria using BADI
entry.content:
Hello,

for a dynamic split of a delivery note into more than one freight unit, not based on static criteria like "split every 20 tons" but considering the planning result of the external TMS optimization, I found BADI "/SCMTMS/FUB_CORE" which might solve this requirement, however, I didn't find any kind of documentation or sample coding on how to use it.

The goal would be like:

  • Delivery note with item having 60 tons
    • Create freight unit #1 with 25 tons, create freight order #1 for this FU
    • Create freight unit #2 with 20 tons, create freight order #2 for this FU
    • Create freight unit #3 with 15 tons, create freight order #3 for this FU

For the next delivery note having 60tons, the requirement for splitting could be 20-21-19 tons, that's the reason why splitting via FUBR doesn't work.

It's possible to manually split a FU using the Fiori app, however, the split mentioned above based on dynamic criteria should happen when creating/saving the delivery note already.

I've checked the TM extension guide as well, however, didn't find a hint.

Any ideas?

Thanks & regards

Wolfgang

entry.title: MRP not considering batch length Correctly
entry.content:
Dear Community,

In a tube industry we are facing a planning issue, and I would appreciate your suggestions or possible workarounds.

Business Context

  • The tube material is managed in meters (UoM).

  • In reality, each piece has a different length (e.g., 2m, 3m, 4m, 5m).

  • In the BOM of a finished product, I need exactly 1 tube of 4m.

Problem
Currently, MRP aggregates the stock in meters.

  • Example: If I have 2 tubes of 2m each, the system considers this equal to 1 tube of 4m, and therefore does not generate a procurement proposal.

  • This results in incorrect planning, as the physical availability does not match the requirement.

Expected Behavior

  • If a 5m tube is available → it should be valid for a 4m requirement (≥ rule).

  • If only 2m tubes are available → the system should trigger a new requirement for a 4m tube.

Questions

  1. How does MRP in S/4HANA Public Cloud integrate with batch characteristics (e.g., Length)?

  2. Is it possible to define a selection rule such as Batch.Length ≥ Required Length?

  3. Or would an additional workaround/extension be necessary to cover this case?

Thank you in advance for your insights.

Best regards,

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Supply Chain 
@Caetano @Tom_Altmueller @swadhinata @Devin_Good

entry.title: Create Z program to update EDPAR entries
entry.content:
Hello team, 

We currently update EDPAR entries using transaction VOE4 , but each time we have to ask the Basis team to open the client after approval. This process takes time. We would like to create a Z program to handle this instead.

Can anyone advise? Should we use BDC for VOE4, or is there a relevant function module available?

Thank you very much.

entry.title: Using T.code ME2ON User able to create multiple deliveries with reference to same PO line item.
entry.content:
Dear Colleague,
We are currently working with T-code ME2ON (Subcontracting Cockpit) in our SAP S/4HANA 2021 (on-premise) system.
We have observed that the system allows users to create multiple outbound deliveries for the same subcontracting purchase order line item.
We need to implement a control to restrict this behavior, ideally allowing only a single delivery per PO item, or preventing the creation of a subsequent delivery once one has already been created.


Could you please advise if there are any standard Master Data or Configuration options available to enforce this restriction? If standard configuration is insufficient, what is the recommended enhancement or user exit approach?

 

Thanks & Regards, 

Manohar

entry.title: MD01N Behavior: Provision Stock at Subcontractor Location Not Considered
entry.content:
We are encountering an issue with the MD01N transaction where it does not appear to recognize stock already provided to a subcontractor (supplier) for use in subcontracting orders.

The Problem: MD01N is generating additional purchase requisitions (PRs) for components that are already available at the subcontractor location.

Observed System Behavior: The system is not treating the provision stock that we have already supplied to the subcontractor as stock that is available for use (similar to unrestricted-use stock) within our main plant's MRP run. This leads to an incorrect demand calculation and the creation of unnecessary PRs.

Please note: We are not using subcontractor MRP areas to manage this stock, and  user dont want to have subcontractor MRP areas.

Required Input: We need your input to help us understand and resolve this issue. Specifically, we need to identify the reason why MD01N does not treat the stock already available for a subcontractor as available/unrestricted-use stock within the plant's MRP calculation when subcontractor MRP areas are not in use.

Could you please provide guidance on the necessary configuration, master data settings, or potential solution that would allow MD01N to correctly consider the provision stock at the subcontractor location?

Please let us know if you require any additional information, such as specific material or plant details.

Thank you for your time and assistance.

 

 

Best regards,

Manohar.

entry.title: Inbound Delivery Types Assignment to Purchase Order Type NB
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to know if it's possible to assign two different types of inbound deliveries to the same purchase order type NB.

I created a new inbound delivery type ZLE, based on the standard delivery type LE. However, when trying to assign it to the confirmation control key, I’m unable to copy or reference the standard LA type.

The requirement is as follows:

For one specific process using PO type NB, we need to work with movement types 103/105.

In another process (also using PO type NB), we require movement types 107/109.

In both cases, an inbound delivery is mandatory.

Is there a way to achieve this setup? Any suggestions or guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Best regards,

entry.title: why Inbound delivery can't be displayed individually in MD04
entry.content:
Dear Experts, I need your expertise regarding an issue we're encountering. As depicted in the attached screenshot, there are three LA entries for item 20 in the PO confirmation tab, each with a different LA number and distinct delivery dates. However, MD04 is only displaying a single line. Ideally, MD04 should show three separate shipment lines to reflect the individual delivery dates accurately. at the same time, the PO notes (AB conformation) displayed by individual delivery dates.

Do you have any suggestions or insights into this LA MD04 display issue? Any feedback or guidance you can provide would be greatly appreciated. Thanks so much!

 #SAP ECC ERP, #Production Planning and Control > Material Requirements Planning, #Confirmation control #MD04

entry.title: is it possible to amend RM code to convert for Sale module
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

We have a raw material code created in the system. We manufacture a final product with these materials. We have a surplus of raw materials stored for a long time, and we need to sell them. How can I do this? Do I create new codes for these materials and treat them as a final product, or what? Please advise me.

Thank you
